segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you, again, the great series, I'm Sorry I Love You Part 6.
segments.cn: 今天我们再次为您带来精彩系列《对不起，我爱你》第六部分。

segments.en: The newest installment in the EnglishPod soap opera.
Drama, romance.
Love, tragedy.
All of it here at EnglishPod and in our series.
segments.cn: 所有这些都在EnglishPod和我们的系列中。

segments.en: So, today we have a really great dialogue.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个非常精彩的对话。

segments.en: I just can't believe what's happening here.
segments.cn: 我简直不敢相信这里发生的事情。

segments.en: But before we get into it, we need to preview one word.
segments.cn: 但在我们开始之前，我们需要预览一个单词。

segments.en: That's right.
So let's take a look at it in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 那么让我们在词汇预览中看看它。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
Well, we're going to preview this word.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们要预览这个词。

segments.en: Sleeping with.
Sleeping with.
Sleeping with someone.
Sleeping is pretty easy.
I mean, sleeping with, it just sounds like you are in bed with somebody.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，和某人睡觉，听起来就像你和某人在床上。

segments.en: Yeah, but you are doing a little bit more than sleeping.
segments.cn: 是的，但你做的事情比睡觉多一点。

segments.en: Alright, so in English this phrase actually means that you are involved with someone and have an intimate sexual relationship, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，在英语中，这个短语实际上意味着你和某人有亲密的性关系，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, you are in a relationship with someone and you are having sex.
segments.cn: 是的，你和某人有关系，并且发生了性关系。

segments.en: Exactly, so be careful how you use it because I know that sometimes you want to translate and just say, well, they are in the same bed together, but it's not that they are having sex.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以要小心使用，因为我知道有时你想翻译并只是说，他们在同一张床上，但并不是说他们发生了性关系。

segments.en: Right, so most of the time in English the phrase sleeping with means sex.
segments.cn: 对，所以在英语中，短语和某人睡觉大多数时候意味着性。

segments.en: Right, okay, sleeping with.
Be careful.
Okay, well let's find out why are we talking about sleeping with?
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们来看看为什么我们在谈论和某人睡觉？

segments.en: Well, obviously somebody is sleeping with somebody, so let's listen to the dialogue and then we'll come back and talk about it.
segments.cn: 显然，有人和某人睡觉，所以让我们听听对话，然后我们再回来讨论。

segments.en: This is ridiculous.
I can't believe you've been sleeping with someone else.
segments.cn: 我简直不敢相信你和别人睡觉。

segments.en: How could you do this?
You know what?
I'm out of here.
Wait!
Doctor, how is this possible?
I haven't cheated on my boyfriend.
segments.cn: 我没有背叛我的男朋友。

segments.en: I have something to confess.
I'm sorry, Veronica.
I lied.
Wait, what?
What do you mean?
I lied.
You aren't even pregnant.
There's no bun in the oven.
I was just so overwhelmed with jealousy that I couldn't help myself.
segments.cn: 我只是因为嫉妒而感到不知所措，无法自拔。

segments.en: Veronica, I love you.
What are you talking about?
Who are you?
It's me, Daniel.
Don't you remember me from high school?
I sat behind you in science class.
segments.cn: 我在科学课上坐在你后面。

segments.en: I used to go to every football game and watch you in the cheerleading squad.
segments.cn: 我曾经去每场足球比赛，观看你在啦啦队的表现。

segments.en: You were insane.
We never even spoke.
Why did you lie like that to my boyfriend?
segments.cn: 你为什么要对我的男朋友撒谎？

segments.en: Because Veronica, it's not fair.
I love you.
I have since the first day we met.
segments.cn: 从我们第一次见面起我就爱你。

segments.en: Everything was going fine until that jerk came into the picture and ruined everything.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到那个混蛋出现，毁了一切。

segments.en: I went to med school and became a doctor for you.
segments.cn: 我上了医学院，成为了医生，为了你。

segments.en: You always said how you wanted to marry a doctor.
segments.cn: 你总是说你想嫁给一个医生。

segments.en: You will be mine now, one way or another.
segments.cn: 你现在会是我的，无论如何。

segments.en: I heard everything, you lying bastard.
segments.cn: 我听到了所有，你这个撒谎的混蛋。

segments.en: Get your hands off of her.
Scandal again.
Poor Veronica and Steven.
I don't know how their relationship could get more complicated.
segments.cn: 我不知道他们的关系怎么会变得更复杂。

segments.en: It's amazing.
They're having an amazing adventure in their love life.
segments.cn: 他们在爱情生活中经历着惊人的冒险。

segments.en: I'm sure glad my love life looks nothing like this.
segments.cn: 我真高兴我的爱情生活看起来与此完全不同。

segments.en: We saw some really great words.
segments.cn: 我们看到了一些非常好的单词。

segments.en: Let's take a look at them in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们在语言收获中看看它们。

segments.en: The words we're looking at now are about feelings.
segments.cn: 我们现在要看的单词是关于感情的。

segments.en: So let's take a look at the first one.
segments.cn: 那么让我们看看第一个。

segments.en: Confess.
To confess.
So confess, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 那么坦白，这是什么意思？

segments.en: When you confess something, you tell a secret that you've been hiding.
segments.cn: 当你坦白某事时，你告诉一个你一直在隐藏的秘密。

segments.en: Okay, so that's pretty easy.
So you have a secret and you want to tell it to someone, so you are confessing.
segments.cn: 所以你有一个秘密，你想告诉某人，所以你在坦白。

segments.en: Yeah, and it's usually something negative.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是一些负面的事情。

segments.en: Negative, okay.
So Marco, I confess that I stole five dollars from you.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我坦白我从你那里偷了五美元。

segments.en: Oh, you did?
Yeah, sorry.
No wonder my wallet was lighter.
Yeah.
All right, so confess.
I shall not forgive you for this.
Oh, no.
All right, let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: Overwhelmed.
Overwhelmed.
I am overwhelmed.
So when I am overwhelmed, I am filled with emotion.
segments.cn: 所以当我感到不知所措时，我充满了情感。

segments.en: Okay, with emotion.
It can be good emotions and bad emotions, right?
segments.cn: 这可以是好的情感和坏的情感，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, but you feel too much.
It's like you're going to explode.
Okay, I am overwhelmed with joy.
Yes, or I'm overwhelmed with work.
segments.cn: 是的，或者我被工作压得喘不过气。

segments.en: And I am overwhelmed with jealousy.
Like this guy.
Right, and that's our third word.
Jealousy.
Jealousy.
So this is interesting because jealousy is the noun.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为嫉妒是名词。

segments.en: That's right.
It's the feeling of being jealous, which is the adjective.
segments.cn: 这是嫉妒的感觉，形容词。

segments.en: Which is the adjective.
So what does it mean when you are jealous?
segments.cn: 那么，当你嫉妒时是什么意思？

segments.en: It means that you see somebody and you want what they have.
segments.cn: 意思是你看到某人，想要他们拥有的东西。

segments.en: Okay, you want what they have.
segments.cn: 好吧，你想要他们的东西。

segments.en: So in this case, the doctor is jealous of Veronica's boyfriend because the doctor wants Veronica.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，医生嫉妒维罗妮卡的男朋友，因为医生想要维罗妮卡。

segments.en: Okay, jealous.
So Erika, are you a jealous wife?
segments.cn: 所以埃里卡，你是个嫉妒的妻子吗？

segments.en: I don't know, maybe a little bit.
But I've never gone to the extent of telling someone that they're pregnant.
segments.cn: 但我从未告诉过别人他们怀孕了。

segments.en: Alright, jealousy.
Okay, and let's take a look at our next two words, which are actually kind of insults, right?
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看接下来的两个词，实际上有点侮辱，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, they're not very kind words at all.
segments.cn: 是的，这些词一点也不友好。

segments.en: Okay, but you've got to learn them anyways.
segments.cn: 好吧，但你还是得学会它们。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at this one.
Jerk.
Jerk.
He's a jerk.
J-E-R-K.
Jerk.
Jerk.
So what does it mean if someone is a jerk?
segments.cn: 那么如果某人是混蛋是什么意思？

segments.en: A stupid and mean person.
Plain as simple as that.
Stupid and mean.
So can a woman be a jerk?
segments.cn: 那么女人可以是混蛋吗？

segments.en: It's mostly male, but now it's becoming more common to use with women as well.
segments.cn: 主要是男性，但现在也越来越常用在女性身上。

segments.en: Okay, so I can say he is a jerk or she is a jerk.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以说他是个混蛋或她是个混蛋。

segments.en: Yeah, but it is more common for men.
Okay, and now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: You lying bastard.
Bastard.
Bastard.
Bastard.
Wow, this is pretty strong as well.
Yeah, you've got to be careful about this one.
This one is almost a swear word.
Almost, like on the line.
So what does it mean if you call someone a bastard?
segments.cn: 那么如果你称某人为混蛋是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, literally it means your mother and father were not married when you were born.
segments.cn: 嗯，字面意思是你出生时父母没有结婚。

segments.en: When you were born, exactly.
So it is a pretty big insult.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个相当大的侮辱。

segments.en: Yes.
A little bit, I guess.
But it doesn't really, really mean that your mother and father weren't married.
segments.cn: 但这并不真的意味着你父母没有结婚。

segments.en: It means that you are a jerk.
You're a jerk.
You're a really big jerk.
You're a mean person.
A really mean person.
So jerk isn't as strong as a bastard, right?
segments.cn: 所以混蛋没有混蛋那么强烈，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, bastard is stronger.
Okay, so you've got to be careful when you throw that word in there or how you would use it.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你得小心使用这个词。

segments.en: And again, it's for men, right?
segments.cn: 再说一次，这个词是针对男性的，对吧？

segments.en: Not for women.
Yeah, you can't use this word with women.
segments.cn: 是的，你不能用这个词对女性。

segments.en: Oh, okay.
There's another one out there, but that will have to wait for another English pod.
segments.cn: 还有另一个词，但那得等到下一个英语播客。

segments.en: Well, apparently all of these words are just for men.
segments.cn: 好吧，显然这些词都是针对男性的。

segments.en: What did we do wrong?
Marco, I can't begin to tell you.
segments.cn: 马尔科，我无法开始告诉你。

segments.en: Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue again and then we'll come back and look at some great phrases.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们再回来看看一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: This is ridiculous.
I can't believe you've been sleeping with someone else.
segments.cn: 我无法相信你和别人睡觉。

segments.en: How could you do this?
You know what?
I'm out of here.
Wait!
Doctor, how is this possible?
I haven't cheated on my boyfriend.
segments.cn: 我没有背叛我的男朋友。

segments.en: I have something to confess.
I'm sorry, Veronica.
I lied.
Wait, what?
What do you mean?
I lied.
You aren't even pregnant.
There's no bun in the oven.
I was just so overwhelmed with jealousy that I couldn't help myself.
segments.cn: 我只是太嫉妒了，无法自拔。

segments.en: Veronica, I love you!
What are you talking about?
Who are you?
It's me, Daniel.
Don't you remember me from high school?
I sat behind you in science class.
segments.cn: 我在科学课上坐在你后面。

segments.en: I used to go to every football game and watch you in the cheerleading squad.
segments.cn: 我以前每场足球比赛都去看你在拉拉队。

segments.en: You're insane!
We never even spoke.
Why did you lie like that to my boyfriend?
segments.cn: 你为什么要对我的男朋友撒谎？

segments.en: Because, Veronica, it's not fair!
segments.cn: 因为，维罗妮卡，这不公平！

segments.en: I love you!
I have since the first day we met.
segments.cn: 从我们第一次见面起我就爱你。

segments.en: Everything was going fine until that jerk came into the picture and ruined everything.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到那个混蛋出现，毁了一切。

segments.en: I went to med school and became a doctor for you!
segments.cn: 我上医学院，成为医生是为了你！

segments.en: You always said how you wanted to marry a doctor?
segments.cn: 你总是说你想嫁给医生？

segments.en: You will be mine now, one way or another.
segments.cn: 你现在会是我的，无论如何。

segments.en: I heard everything, you lying bastard!
segments.cn: 我听到了所有，你这个撒谎的混蛋！

segments.en: Get your hands off of her!
Alright, so, great stuff, jerk, bastards, all that good words going around.
segments.cn: 好吧，太好了，混蛋，都是些好词。

segments.en: But we've also got some amazing phrases.
segments.cn: 但我们也有一些很棒的短语。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在来看看这些短语在流利表达中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Alright, so in Fluency Builder today we have three great phrases.
segments.cn: 流利表达 好吧，今天在流利表达中我们有三个很棒的短语。

segments.en: Let's take a look at the first one.
Bun in the oven.
A bun in the oven.
A bun in the oven.
Okay, this is obviously an idiomatic phrase, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这显然是一个习惯用语，对吧？

segments.en: Well, it could be literal as well, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，它也可以是字面意思，对吧？

segments.en: Like you could actually have a piece of bread in your oven.
segments.cn: 比如你真的可以在烤箱里放一块面包。

segments.en: Right, bun is a piece of bread in the oven.
segments.cn: 对，面包是在烤箱里的面包。

segments.en: But in this context we're not using it.
segments.cn: 但在这个上下文中我们并不是这样用。

segments.en: No, it means you're pregnant.
segments.cn: 不，它的意思是你怀孕了。

segments.en: You're pregnant.
So the baby is the bun.
Yeah, and the oven is your stomach.
segments.cn: 是的，烤箱就是你的肚子。

segments.en: Right, so you say she has a bun in the oven.
Yes, she's pregnant.
She's pregnant, okay.
It could be difficult to understand if you don't really have the explanation, right?
segments.cn: 如果你没有解释，可能会很难理解，对吧？

segments.en: Yes.
You would say, what?
She has bread in the oven?
What?
Yeah, a bun in the oven.
Okay, now let's take a look at the second one.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看第二个。

segments.en: Couldn't help myself.
I couldn't help myself.
I couldn't help myself.
So when you can't help yourself, you can't control yourself.
segments.cn: 所以当你无法自拔时，你无法控制自己。

segments.en: Right, you did something but you couldn't control it.
segments.cn: 对，你做了某事但无法控制。

segments.en: You couldn't stop it.
You couldn't stop it.
Okay, so let's listen to some examples of how you would use I couldn't help myself because it's a phrase that you can use in many different ways, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们听一些例子，看看你如何使用“我无法自拔”，因为这是一个可以用多种方式使用的短语，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, let's listen.
Example 1.
I just couldn't help myself when I saw your car.
segments.cn: 我看到你的车时无法自拔。

segments.en: I just had to buy it.
Example 2.
I'm sorry, I couldn't help myself.
I just started laughing.
Example 3.
That cake was so good.
I couldn't help myself.
I ate it all.
Alright, perfect.
Couldn't help myself.
Easy.
Now, the doctor, he couldn't help himself from lying to Veronica because he was angry that her boyfriend, Steven, came into the picture.
segments.cn: 现在，医生无法自拔地对维罗妮卡撒谎，因为他对她的男朋友史蒂文的出现感到愤怒。

segments.en: Came into the picture.
To come into the picture.
Okay, so what does it mean when somebody comes into the picture?
segments.cn: 好吧，当某人出现时，这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, basically, you appear in somebody's life.
segments.cn: 嗯，基本上，你出现在某人的生活中。

segments.en: You come into somebody's life.
So imagine that your life is a picture and somebody all of a sudden comes into it.
segments.cn: 所以想象一下你的生活是一幅画，突然有人进入了它。

segments.en: They come into the picture.
They come into your life.
So he's angry that Steven appeared into Veronica's life and they're in love and all that stuff, right?
segments.cn: 所以他对史蒂文出现在维罗妮卡的生活中感到愤怒，他们相爱，所有这些，对吧？

segments.en: Alright, well these are some great phrases and why don't we listen to them again in context.
segments.cn: 好吧，这些都是很棒的短语，为什么我们不再在上下文中听听它们。

segments.en: So let's listen to the dialogue.
This is ridiculous.
I can't believe you've been sleeping with someone else.
segments.cn: 我无法相信你和别人睡觉。

segments.en: How could you do this?
You know what?
I'm out of here.
I'm so overwhelmed with jealousy that I couldn't help myself.
segments.cn: 我被嫉妒压倒，无法自拔。

segments.en: Veronica, I love you!
What are you talking about?
Who are you?
It's me, Daniel.
Don't you remember me from high school?
I sat behind you in science class.
segments.cn: 我在科学课上坐在你后面。

segments.en: I used to go to every football game and watch you in the cheerleading squad.
segments.cn: 我以前总是去看每场足球比赛，观看你的啦啦队表演。

segments.en: You're insane!
We never even spoke.
Why did you lie like that to my boyfriend?
segments.cn: 你为什么要对我男朋友撒谎？

segments.en: Because, Veronica, it's not fair!
segments.cn: 因为，维罗妮卡，这不公平！

segments.en: I love you!
I have since the first day we met.
segments.cn: 从我们第一次见面起我就爱你。

segments.en: Everything was going fine until that jerk came into the picture and ruined everything.
segments.cn: 一切都很好，直到那个混蛋出现，毁了一切。

segments.en: I went to med school and became a doctor for you!
segments.cn: 我上医学院，成为医生是为了你！

segments.en: You always said how you wanted to marry a doctor?
segments.cn: 你总是说你想嫁给医生？

segments.en: You will be mine now, one way or another.
segments.cn: 你现在会是我的，无论如何。

segments.en: I heard everything, you lying bastard!
segments.cn: 我听到了所有，你这个撒谎的混蛋！

segments.en: Get your hands off of her!
Okay, so Veronica's not pregnant.
segments.cn: 好吧，维罗妮卡并没有怀孕。

segments.en: That was a close one.
Actually, they're not married, so this is a very controversial topic, right?
segments.cn: 其实，他们并没有结婚，所以这是一个非常有争议的话题，对吧？

segments.en: Being knocked up.
Yes, nice phrase.
Nice phrase.
So, there's a lot of interesting phrases and ways you can talk about pregnancy.
segments.cn: 所以，有很多有趣的短语和方式可以谈论怀孕。

segments.en: So if you're knocked up, you're pregnant.
segments.cn: 所以如果你怀孕了，你就是怀孕了。

segments.en: Right, so you can hear that in movies.
segments.cn: 对，所以你可以在电影中听到这个。

segments.en: It's not really, I would say, a proper way of saying that.
segments.cn: 这并不是我认为的一个合适的说法。

segments.en: No, it's not that polite because it gives you the idea that it was a mistake.
segments.cn: 不，这并不太礼貌，因为它给人一种这是个错误的印象。

segments.en: Right.
So you would say, she got knocked up.
Yes.
Another common phrase is preggers.
segments.cn: 另一个常见的短语是“怀孕了”。

segments.en: Preggers.
I heard this is more Australian, right?
segments.cn: 我听说这个更像是澳大利亚的说法，对吧？

segments.en: She's preggers, so she's pregnant.
segments.cn: 她怀孕了，所以她怀孕了。

segments.en: So it's actually a pretty interesting topic.
segments.cn: 所以这实际上是一个相当有趣的话题。

segments.en: I know that, for example, in Latin America, if a girl that's maybe in her early 20s gets pregnant accidentally by her boyfriend, usually the families expect them to get married.
segments.cn: 我知道，例如，在拉丁美洲，如果一个20出头的女孩意外怀孕了，通常家庭会期望他们结婚。

segments.en: Really?
Yeah, so it's kind of like, should they get married, should they not?
segments.cn: 是的，所以就像，他们应该结婚吗？

segments.en: So there's a lot of pressure.
A lot of pressure.
But it's different in other countries, right?
segments.cn: 但在其他国家是不同的，对吧？

segments.en: So, I don't know, for you guys, what's it like in your country where you live?
segments.cn: 所以，我不知道，你们那里的情况如何？

segments.en: Is there pressure on the guy and the girl to get married?
segments.cn: 男孩和女孩有压力结婚吗？

segments.en: I mean, should Steven and Veronica get married in this situation?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，斯蒂文和维罗妮卡在这种情况下应该结婚吗？

segments.en: Or what about just living together?
Or as they say, living in sin, right?
segments.cn: 或者他们所说的，生活在罪中，对吧？

segments.en: Living in sin.
Living together, living in sin.
So is it okay to just live together with your girlfriend?
segments.cn: 所以和女朋友同居可以吗？

segments.en: Or should you get married before?
This is a controversial topic, so we'll have a lot of different opinions.
segments.cn: 这是一个有争议的话题，所以我们会有很多不同的意见。

segments.en: But it should be interesting.
Yes, so visit our website and tell us what you think.
segments.cn: 是的，访问我们的网站，告诉我们你的想法。

segments.en: EnglishPod.com Alright guys, we'll see you there.
segments.cn: EnglishPod.com 好吧，大家，我们在那里见。
